pr_title: Kiwix Serve welcome page dynamic and subset loading (OPDS based)
pr_body: @kelson42 this resolves #511 and #514. Filters will be added in other PR.
pr_review_comments:

I am a bit confused as would it be over-doing things?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 14, 56, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638141925, 'comment_body': "Currently, it doesn't make any difference, but it's more future-proof to advance `incrementalLoadingParams.start` by the count of items actually loaded.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 17, 31, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'veloman-yunkan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638146026, 'comment_body': 'What is the justification for the `incrementalLoadingParams.count > viewPortToCount()` check?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 17, 38, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'veloman-yunkan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638148715, 'comment_body': 'You can move this check into the `loadAndDisplayBooks()` function.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 17, 42, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'veloman-yunkan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638176950, 'comment_body': 'it is not a good solution as in the case of filters the process is different. I would like to keep it as it is, if it is fine with you:sweat_smile:', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 18, 31, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638177473, 'comment_body': 'to check if the screen size is reduced in that case, no new data should be fetched until and unless we are at the bottom of the page.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 18, 32, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638180715, 'comment_body': '@veloman-yunkan what about this?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 18, 36, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638220266, 'comment_body': "My point is that the `incrementalLoadingParams.count > viewPortToCount()` check is redundant. The bottom-of-the-page test is enough, isn't it? If so, then handling of resize and scroll events becomes identical, and then introducing another function is justified. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 19, 26, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'veloman-yunkan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638221475, 'comment_body': "> The bottom-of-the-page test is enough, isn't it?

Though this depends on when the resize event fires - before or after the layout is updated.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 19, 29, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'veloman-yunkan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638259892, 'comment_body': 'oh sorry, I forgot about that part you are right it should work fine if we are including the bottom of the page test.
also, the event is fired after the layout is updated. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 24, 20, 45, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638885992, 'comment_body': 'Why removing this ?

OPDS stream list zim file a user can download. If we remove the `remote(true)` filter, we will return zim file without url to download from.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 25, 15, 8, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638890154, 'comment_body': "If we don't use the `books` variable in the template, we should not set it in the cpp side.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 25, 15, 11, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638978916, 'comment_body': "@mgautierfr kelson discussed this point earlier in the PR and we agreed that we should show all zim files and show a disabled download button(and a tooltip) for those zim files that can't be downloaded.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 25, 16, 42, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 638979501, 'comment_body': 'I agree on this point I was going to open a separate issue for this, but if you want it removed from cpp side I will create a new PR and add that part in some time.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 25, 16, 43, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 639458832, 'comment_body': 'The problem is that ODPS stream is already used (and designed for) native client which list what zim files user can download.
By definition, the user can download a zim file if they have a associated url (they are "remote").
If you remove this filter, you break the API for existing client.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 26, 7, 13, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 639459548, 'comment_body': 'Why the next time ? I don't "want" to remove the cpp code. I want to have the template and the cpp in sync.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 26, 7, 14, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 639481965, 'comment_body': "@mgautierfr Can you please be specific? I'm not aware of anything broken. If OPDS should not list anymore books with URL, it should list all books. This is necessary for the welcome page and this is more logical because the URL is only one attribute beetween others of the book. If at some point we need to filter on URL them we should add a new filter, but AFAIK this is not needed to the moment.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 26, 7, 48, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kelson42', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 639516076, 'comment_body': 'kiwix-desktop uses OPDS stream to propose zim file to download to the user. If OPDS\xa0stream now return one zim file without "url" attribute, kiwix-desktop will display to book to the user but he will not be able to download it.
(I've checked and kiwix-desktop reapply this filter internally before displaying books to the user, but other implementation (kiwix-android, kiwix-ios)) may not do the same).
(And this is maybe hypotical anyway as most (if not all) zim files in library.kiwix.org have a url, but if someone use a local opds stream, it will be broken)

This is a OPDS API break, we cannot change the content returned by a stream like that.
We may want to change this behavior or not (we can extend the catalog/v2 to handle this feature and use catalog/v2), but if we change it we have to be careful about this.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 26, 8, 34, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 639554596, 'comment_body': 'by remove, I meant that onlyðŸ˜….... I will bring them in sync.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 26, 9, 25, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 639563769, 'comment_body': "@mgautierfr @kelson42 instead of creating a completely new endpoint wouldn't it be better if I just introduce a new search parameter that will check if we need all zim files and changes filter accordingly?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 26, 9, 38, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 639604313, 'comment_body': '@mgautierfr Kiwix-Desktop works perfectly, so there is no problem, there is no API break, there is no documentation to update. What you are talking about seems to be a potential problem if for some reason library.kiwix.org would deliver an OPDS stream with books without URLs. An "yes" I confirm, this is the resonsability of the person running the kiwix-serve to have a `library.xml` with URL if he wants that these books are downloadable. What is *concretly* wrong here or broken?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 5, 26, 10, 38, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kelson42', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Dynamic and subset loading of catalogue in kiwix-serve
corrected relative links in preview and icon url
Add filters to kiwix-serve welcome page
pr_body:
@kelson42 this resolves #531, #517 and #519,

@veloman-yunkan this PR focuses on adding filter library and effects related to subset loading and filtering, this PR also creates a base for other filters which are yet to be implemented. the filter options are derived from a static list for now. 
All of these features are listed by kelson [here](https://github.com/kiwix/libkiwix/pull/534#issuecomment-855231601)

As for the implementation part, this PR uses `isotope.js` for filtering as suggested by kelson, `Isotope` is used for the effects it adds.
the functionality was achieved using the following implementation - 

- when users clicks on filter `resetAndFilter()` is called which resets all basic configuration and calls `loadAndDisplayBooks()`.
- `loadAndDisplayBooks()` fetches books based on the filters applied using OPDS, then it calls isotope filter and uses it to hide the elements that are not present in books retrieved for the current filters(the books are not yet deleted but just hidden by isotope), then the hidden books are deleted and if the books that were fetched had more books then currently on-screen remaining books are inserted as well.
- the books need to preserve the order they came in from OPDS response so I have used the isotopes sorting feature and added an index to each book and used it for sorting(handled automatically by isotope).
- Why haven't I just removed all current results from the screen and added all from the OPDS response? If I do so, the isotope's effect won't work properly as isotope has a transition effect, and for that to be performed, the element should have the same reference and shouldn't be re-rendered.
- And as for why I first hide and then delete the element? If I just remove it while filtering is going on then there is a problem with the layout caused by isotope(most probably because some elements are then skipped during iteration).

pr_title: Use OPDS API to populate categories/languages select boxes on Kiwix Serve welcome page
pr_body:
fixes #555 
@kelson42 instead of using DOM for XML parsing this PR uses string manipulation as for some reason xml produced by language endpoint couldn't be parsed on latest version of firefox.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 683636174, 'comment_body': "Don't forget about `root`", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 5, 17, 4, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'veloman-yunkan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 683639996, 'comment_body': "Special handling of languages doesn't feel right. Why don't you make the `type` parameter of `loadAndDisplayOptions()` mandatory and pass it to `getInnerHtml()` unmodified?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 5, 17, 10, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'veloman-yunkan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 683710252, 'comment_body': "@veloman-yunkan that doesn't seem right to me.....there is no meaning of adding `type` to `getInnerHtml()` it's all because the value for langugae options need to be iso-3 value of language while for categories title and value are same.
can you be more specific please.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 5, 18, 54, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 683935906, 'comment_body': "I meant having

```
const value = getInnerHtml(entry, type);
```

in `loadAndDisplayOptions()` and calling the latter as follows:

```
await loadAndDisplayOptions('#languageFilter', `${root}/catalog/v2/languages`, 'language');
await loadAndDisplayOptions('#categoryFilter', `${root}/catalog/v2/categories`, 'title');
```

Then the `type` parameter of `loadAndDisplayOptions()` should be renamed too (`entry_node_name`?).", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 6, 4, 20, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'veloman-yunkan', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Keep Kiwix Serve filter values over time
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 657670478, 'comment_body': 'space incoherence', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 24, 6, 47, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kelson42', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 657778290, 'comment_body': 'Why rename this to `bookOrderMap` ?

Are the books ordered ?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 24, 9, 19, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 657779245, 'comment_body': 'It would be nice to have a comment telling that `24*60*60*1000` is a day.
And even better, having a const name "1daydelta", computed once and doing the job of the comment.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 24, 9, 20, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 657785137, 'comment_body': 'Do we really need this ? (Or at least, do we need it all the time ?)

It seems we pass here when we have loaded the page (so after a the user arrive to the page).
So the url should already be in the history.
We may want to pushstate if we modify the "url" internally but this is not the case here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 24, 9, 28, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 657801734, 'comment_body': '@mgautierfr yes the books are ordered and this is something that was requested by veloman in my previous PR but got missed so adding it here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 24, 9, 52, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 657806497, 'comment_body': "@mgautierfr this is needed here as in the case we get params from cookies the URL is not updated and 
L238 -> `params.forEach((value, key) => {document.getElementsByName(key)[0].value = value});`
doesn't dispatch an on change event it just changes the value if I call a dispatch event here it will mean we will be pushing into history for each separate filter so if the user wants to go back he would have to click 3-4 time which wouldn't be a good thing and as the filters were called together there should be only one step for them. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 24, 9, 58, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 657899250, 'comment_body': 'Haa, I've missed that the map is not a map between a book and a id but is a map between a book id and the order of the book.
We are good. (But it would have been nice to have this in a separated commit. It has nothing to do with "added cookies for filter effect". And the commit message could have explain why we've changed this.)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 24, 12, 26, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 657903299, 'comment_body': 'Couldn't we dispatch a event after L238 ?
Once we have changed all the values, we "apply" them.

---

It seems to me that if push a new history state here and the user go the url with cookies, we will have two history state:
- The url without param.
- The url with param (taken from cookies).

But the two are somehow the same state has the url without param will be initialized the same way than the second (and will insert a new state).
So if the user want to go back, he would have to click 2 times (fast enough to not let the page load the fist time)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 24, 12, 32, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 658247269, 'comment_body': '> Couldn't we dispatch a event after L238 ?
Once we have changed all the values, we "apply" them.

we can't dispatch a single event to change the URL and apply the filters all together as it calls `resetAndFilter` which only changes URL (by pushing into history only if there is a single filter change that is passed through it).
and even if we could it would still mean we would be pushing a new state into history.

>  It seems to me that if push a new history state here and the user go the url with cookies, we will have two history state:
The url without param.
The url with param (taken from cookies).
But the two are somehow the same state has the url without param will be initialized the same way than the second (and will insert a new state).
So if the user want to go back, he would have to click 2 times (fast enough to not let the page load the fist time)

agreed upon this part but at this moment I couldn't think of something else that would have a single back click as we are changing the URL through JS as always.
this similar thing happens when there is no cookie saved and user goes to the site and browser language is detected and a filter is applied in that case as well user has to click 2 times.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 24, 20, 6, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 658496863, 'comment_body': "I had a look and I believe to understand the situation. On my side I requested that @MananJethwani secures that the filter status is always synced with the URL params (I believe the reasons are obvious). This forces him to add an entry in the history to set the URL params properly based on the cookies. We get then 2 entries. Obviously it is possible to to load from the cookies and don't update the URL, but then my request would not be respected anymore. A choice has to be made. In my case I strongly prefer the current situation, ie. garanty that a user can copy the URL and will get the same result again.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 25, 6, 3, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kelson42', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Revamped Kiwix Serve Welcome page layout
pr_body:
@kelson42 this fixes kiwix/kiwix-tools#448 and fixes https://github.com/kiwix/kiwix-tools/issues/370
for now, I have changed the basic layout and updated the cards.

pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 700841153, 'comment_body': 'Do we need to store it as a member ?
We use `customIndexTemplate` to locate and generate `m_indexTemplateString` but never after.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 2, 7, 55, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 700841592, 'comment_body': 'Please remove the commented code.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 2, 7, 55, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 700845059, 'comment_body': "I'm not sure we simply want to print a message and go with(out) it.

If a user ask to use a specific template and we cannot find it, it is probably a error.

---

In fact, I wonder if the user may directly pass the template string to the constructor and not the path to a file. This simplify a lot the things on libkiwix side and allow use case where the template is not stored in a file (generated template, ...)
It would be to kiwix-serve/kiwix-desktop/wrapper to load the template and pass it to the server's constructor.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 2, 8, 0, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 702687237, 'comment_body': '@mgautierfr any example or some resource I can refer for this....not exactly a cpp dev.
I guess we should have a discussion regarding this with @kelson42 before going ahead.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 6, 7, 59, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 703531160, 'comment_body': "You have pretty everything you need.
Instead of adding a argument `customIndexTemplate(path)`, directly add the argument `indexTemplateString`. (And use `RESOURCE::templates::index_html` if the string is empty)

And move the code loading the template from `customIndexTemplate` (you 've already implemented) in kiwix-serve.

But yes, we may agree with @kelson42 on the feature before going ahead. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 7, 13, 52, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 708104825, 'comment_body': 'This could be made once at `InternalServer` construction.
No need to check every time if m_indexTemplateString is empty as it will never change.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 14, 9, 49, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 708106360, 'comment_body': 'Do we really need a default argument here ?
This is internal, so no api compatibility to keep.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 14, 9, 51, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 708107234, 'comment_body': 'Please add a doc string.
And making this function part of the public api could (should) be moved in a separated commit.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 14, 9, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 709729250, 'comment_body': '@mgautierfr I will change the commit history once PR is ready to get merged', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 16, 3, 46, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 718479415, 'comment_body': 'It would be nice to have a test is a real custom index template and testing it is correctly used.

At least with a dummy template with only a single, simple content and test that it is actually this content which is returned.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 29, 12, 52, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 718491068, 'comment_body': 'It is better to have a "positive" test.
We can always set `m_indexTemplateString` to `indexTemplateString` in the initializer list and then, in the constructor body, test if `m_indexTemplateString` is empty and then set it to `RESOURCE::templates::index_html`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 29, 13, 5, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 723216229, 'comment_body': 'This can be better written like :
```cpp
auto zfs_ = sd::unique_ptr<ZimFileServer>(new ZimFileServer(PORT, ZIMFILES, ""));
EXPECT_EQ(200, zfs_->GET("/")->status);
```
No need to call reset at the end as the unique_ptr will delete the allocated ZimFileServer (this is the only purpose of unique_ptr, it would be sad to not us it correctly)

(Same for the test `indexTemplateCheck`)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 6, 12, 52, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 723220283, 'comment_body': 'This should be replace by the actual list of book no ?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 6, 12, 54, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 723293949, 'comment_body': 'I have removed the script that inserts the book list, the thing that actually checks if the template is being used is the `title` tag', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 6, 13, 47, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 723331989, 'comment_body': '@mgautierfr do you want me to add back the script and check if zim files are present as well, according to me the test is not about if zim files are rendered but about if template is loaded so according to me no need to add a script right?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 6, 14, 24, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 723363934, 'comment_body': "Yes, rendering the template is already tested with other tests. Here we are testing if we correctly use the provided template. We can keep it like this.
(But we main reduce a bit the template to some kind of minimal content, as we don't care about the content let's be even more explicit.)", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 6, 14, 55, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mgautierfr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 726127261, 'comment_body': 'fixed', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 11, 13, 38, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 726127336, 'comment_body': 'fixed', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 11, 13, 38, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 726127670, 'comment_body': 'fixed', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 11, 13, 39, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MananJethwani', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 727165672, 'comment_body': 'The pointer is not necessary here.
